introduction.para: In this topic, we will present the contents of the sample help collection provided with the HelpRegister.exe.
The main compiled sample help file is the HelpRegister user manual and schema references in the Help 2.0 format.

content.para: The following is the content of the sample configuration file:
content.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <register xmlns:help2="http://www.simmack.de/2006/help2"> <!-- 1. Register Sandcastle.HelpRegister as our namespace --> <namespace name="Sandcastle.HelpRegister" description="Sandcastle HelpRegister Collection" file="CollHelpRegister.HxC"> <!-- 2. Register the HelpRegister.HxS help file --> <file Id="HelpRegister" HxS="HelpRegister.HxS" LangId="1033" /> <!-- 3. We are no using a custom filter... --> <filter name="(no filter)" /> <plugin> <!-- 4. Plug the "Help on Help" into our collection. The first matched MS.Dexplore.v80.en or MS.Dexplore.v90.en will be used. --> <child name="MS.Dexplore.*" /> </plugin> </namespace> <!-- 5. Plug into existing namespaces, in this case, the VS.NET 2002, 2003, 2005 and VS.NET 2008. --> <plugin parent="MS.VSCC" child="Sandcastle.HelpRegister" merge="yes"/> <plugin parent="MS.VSCC.2003" child="Sandcastle.HelpRegister" merge="no"/> <plugin parent="MS.VSCC.v80" child="Sandcastle.HelpRegister" merge="no"/> <plugin parent="MS.VSCC.v90" child="Sandcastle.HelpRegister" merge="no"/> </register>

content.para: According to the Microsoft documentations, if the collection-level .HxT file is omitted the plug-in will fail. If the .HxK files are omitted, the corresponding index will not appear in the parent collection.
The following are the collection-level files used by the sample:

From the Microsoft documentations, the collection-level .HxC file contains one reference for each of the other collection-level files. For example, the <TOCDef> element refers to the collection-level .HxT, the <KeywordIndexDef> element refers to the collection-level .HxK, and so forth.
The <ItemMoniker> tags are also required, and can be taken from the .HxC file that was used to compile the .HxS file.
The content of this file is:
content.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <!DOCTYPE HelpCollection > <HelpCollection DTDVersion="1.0" Id="CollHelpRegister" FileVersion="1.0.0.0" LangId="1033" Title="Sandcastle HelpRegister" Copyright=""> <TOCDef File="CollHelpRegister.HxT" /> <KeywordIndexDef File="CollHelpRegister_A.HxK" /> <KeywordIndexDef File="CollHelpRegister_B.HxK" /> <KeywordIndexDef File="CollHelpRegister_F.HxK" /> <KeywordIndexDef File="CollHelpRegister_K.HxK" /> <KeywordIndexDef File="CollHelpRegister_S.HxK" /> <KeywordIndexDef File="CollHelpRegister_N.HxK" /> <ItemMoniker Name="!DefaultToc" ProgId="HxDs.HxHierarchy" InitData="" /> <ItemMoniker Name="!DefaultFullTextSearch" ProgId="HxDs.HxFullTextSearch" InitData="" /> <ItemMoniker Name="!DefaultAssociativeIndex" ProgId="HxDs.HxIndex" InitData="A" /> <ItemMoniker Name="!DefaultKeywordIndex" ProgId="HxDs.HxIndex" InitData="K" /> <ItemMoniker Name="!DefaultContextWindowIndex" ProgId="HxDs.HxIndex" InitData="F" /> <ItemMoniker Name="!DefaultNamedUrlIndex" ProgId="HxDs.HxIndex" InitData="NamedUrl" /> <ItemMoniker Name="!DefaultSearchWindowIndex" ProgId="HxDs.HxIndex" InitData="S" /> <ItemMoniker Name="!DefaultDynamicLinkIndex" ProgId="HxDs.HxIndex" InitData="B" /> </HelpCollection>

content.para: The collection-level .HxT file contains a reference to the title ID that each .HxS file in the child namespace was registered with. At run time, the registration services use this information to pull the correct .HxT file from each .HxS file.
The content of this file is:
content.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <!DOCTYPE HelpTOC > <HelpTOC DTDVersion="1.0" Id="CollHelpRegisterTOC" PluginStyle="Hierarchical" PluginTitle="Sandcastle HelpRegister" FileVersion="1.0.0.0" LangId="1033"> <HelpTOCNode NodeType="TOC" Url="HelpRegister" /> </HelpTOC>

content.para: The collection-level .HxK file contains a reference for an index for an .HxS file belonging to the child namespace. Each index should have its own corresponding collection-level .HxK file. For example, if an .HxS file had an .HxK file defined for its keyword index and one for an associative index, it would need two collection-level .HxK files.
The following example shows a collection-level .HxK file for a keyword index.
content.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <!DOCTYPE HelpIndex > <HelpIndex Name="K" DTDVersion="1.0" FileVersion="1.0.0.0" Id="CollHelpRegister_K" AutoInclude="Yes" Merge="Yes" Sort="Yes" Title="Keyword Index" Visible="Yes" LangId="1033"> </HelpIndex>
content.para: The following example shows a collection-level .HxK file for a Named URL.
content.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <!DOCTYPE HelpIndex > <HelpIndex Name="NamedUrl" DTDVersion="1.0" Id="CollHelpRegister_N" AutoInclude="Yes" Merge="Yes" Sort="Yes" Title="Named Url Index" Visible="No" LangId="1033"> </HelpIndex>

content.para: The collection-level .HxA file only needs to contain attributes and values that will be exposed to the user, such as through a filter editing tool.
You can take the data for this file from the .HxA file that was used to compile the .HxS file.

alert.para: This file is not used in this sample, but may be provided in updated sample.
